intro: Hieracium baldense, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium baldense is often found in meadows and rocky areas, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
